projects.name: Power Flow Analysis of IEEE 5 Bus using Artificial Neural Network
projects.summary: Power flow analysis was conducted on an IEEE five-bus system to study phenomena such as over/under voltage and overloads using an ANN architecture. The project aimed to overcome the limitations of traditional power flow algorithms such as Newton’s Raphson and the Fast Decouple method.

projects.name: Electric Service Design
projects.summary: This project focuses on developing a precise electrical plan to ensure tenant comfort and safety while converting a residential property into a ten-story complex, incorporating modern features such as a garage and a rooftop pool.

projects.name: Build-an-8-bit-computer-from-scratch (Inspired by Ben Eater)
projects.summary: This project aims to build an 8-bit SAP (Simple As Possible) computer on a breadboard from scratch, inspired by Ben Eater’s schematics.

projects.name: One Hour POMORDO Clock
projects.summary: This project emphasizes the fabrication of a digital clock capable of performing various clock mechanisms, including a stopwatch and timer.

projects.name: Epileptic Seizure Detection using EEG Signal Processing
projects.summary: This project focuses on implementing an LDA machine learning model to detect epileptic seizures.

projects.name: Advanced Home Automation System with WiFi & Mobile App Based Interface
projects.summary: This project utilized WiFi ESP32/IoT modules and the Blynk mobile app to establish wireless connectivity for controlling appliances such as lights, fans, and monitors. It also enabled the saving of real-time sensor data on a mobile device or the Blynk server.

projects.name: Panzer Fight(Arcade Game)
projects.summary: The game was based on the Gauss-Jordan method with pivot. Two panzers fire shells at each other, with three walls placed between them as barriers.
